publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2065 Ms Wendy Alexander: St Mirren Football Club—That the Parliament congratulates St Mirren Football Club for issuing a lifetime ban to two supporters caught making racial taunts at opposition players during a Scottish Football League (SFL) Division One fixture at St Mirren Park; recognises that St Mirren’s prompt action highlights that the club is serious about implementing the measures contained within UEFA’s 10 point action plan to combat racism in the sport; hopes that the players and staff of other SFL clubs follow in St Mirren’s footsteps for similar incidents, and welcomes remarks from the manager and chairman that St Mirren Football Club is a family-friendly club and this type of behaviour will not be tolerated. Supported by: Mike Pringle*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Watson*, Jackie Baillie*, Richard Baker*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Robin Harper*, Murray Tosh*, Bill Butler*, Margaret Smith*, Brian Adam*, Eleanor Scott*, Helen Eadie*

S2M-2065 St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 24 November 2004) Mr Frank McAveety*, Sarah Boyack*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Des McNulty*, Christine May*, Bristow Muldoon*, Colin Fox*, Scott Barrie*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Dr Jean Turner*, Maureen Macmillan*, John Scott*, Alex Neil*

S2M-2065*#* Ms Wendy Alexander: St Mirren Football Club—That the Parliament congratulates St Mirren Football Club for issuing a lifetime ban to two supporters caught making racial taunts at opposition players during a Scottish Football League (SFL) Division One fixture at St Mirren Park; recognises that St Mirren’s prompt action highlights that the club is serious about implementing the measures contained within UEFA’s 10 point action plan to combat racism in the sport; hopes that the players and staff of other SFL clubs follow in St Mirren’s footsteps for similar incidents, and welcomes remarks from the manager and chairman that St Mirren Football Club is a family-friendly club and this type of behaviour will not be tolerated. Supported by: Mike Pringle, Elaine Smith, Mike Watson, Jackie Baillie, Richard Baker, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Campbell Martin, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Michael McMahon, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Robin Harper, Murray Tosh, Bill Butler, Margaret Smith, Brian Adam, Eleanor Scott, Helen Eadie, Mr Frank McAveety, Sarah Boyack, Dr Elaine Murray, Des McNulty, Christine May, Bristow Muldoon, Colin Fox, Scott Barrie, Michael Matheson, Mr Brian Monteith, Dr Jean Turner, Maureen Macmillan, John Scott, Alex Neil, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-2065# St Mirren Football Club (lodged on 24 November 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Trish Godman*, John Swinburne*
